sn55.47:4.2: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to Nandiya the Sakyan:
sn55.47:4.3: “Nandiya, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.47:5.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.47:5.7: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.47:5.9: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
